Ninja Guy
From a peaceful training village to a hell-like demon world, you become Ninja Guy, in his hilariously epic quest to prove himself to the Holy Cow Sensei and bring down an evil gargantuan Minotaur! Remember... Guns don't kill people, Ninja do!

Reviews

“This is the stuff memes are made of. It’s pretty easy to figure out why Immunity Studios decided to create a game about a ninja trainee with an overdone accent, who takes orders from a beret-wearing cow: it’s ripe ground for some of the most hilarious one-liners ever delivered on iOS.”
iFanzine

About This Game

Ninja Guy, the humorous and quirky ninja action game has now come to Steam! This version includes all new exclusive improvements such as refined gameplay, graphical post effects and Steam Achievements!

Ninja Guy has generated somewhat of a cult following on mobile and has amassed over 70,000 Ninja Guy fans on Facebook! Now, the Ninjaverse has never looked as awesome with realtime dynamic lights and shadows, gorgeous screen effects, more than twice the amount of enemies on screen and totally revamped gameplay to allow for super fun action using the Joypad or the Keyboard / Mouse!

From a peaceful training village to a hell-like demon world, you control Ninja Guy! You will guide him on his bizarre and epic quest to prove himself to the Holy Cow Sensei by bringing down an evil gargantuan Minotaur! You are Cow Sensei's last hope, and final student .. Will you finally attain your Ninjaness?

Ninja Guy will have you laughing along to his almost never-ending supply of dim-witted Ninja catchphrases, such as the classic "2 + 2 = NINZAAA!" Remember... Gun's don't kill people, Ninja Do!
READ MORE

System Requirements

Windows
Mac OS X
SteamOS + Linux
    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP
    • Processor: 1.6 GHz Processor (w/ SSE2 Instruction Set Support)
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: 512MB Graphics Card, 1024x768 Minimum Screen Resolution, DX9 (shader model 2.0) capabilities; generally everything made since 2004 should work.
    • Hard Drive: 500 MB available space
    Recommended:
    • OS: Windows 8
    • Processor: 2 GHz Processor (w/ SSE2 Instruction Set Support)
    • Memory: 4 GB RAM
    • Graphics: 1GB Graphics Card, 1024x768 Minimum Screen Resolution, DX9 (shader model 2.0) capabilities; generally everything made since 2004 should work.
    • Hard Drive: 500 MB available space
    Minimum:

Not Recommended
1.3 hrs on record
Posted: September 30
This game is like a drunk slob in a bar:

He's ugly, he smells, he got bugs and he's telling racist jokes while thinking he's hilarious. You just want to slap him in the face, really, really hard!

It's an easy 100% if that's what you're looking for, like me. But I'm pretty sure this game gave me std's during the hour I played it.

bigh
1,484 products in account
151 reviews
Not Recommended
1.0 hrs on record
Posted: May 15
Ninja Guy comes from iOS and is a 3D platformer with awful graphics and sound.
The game should be funny but it feels like a permanent insult of everything like "there are not enough MFs to kill" (original quote). Disgusting. You proceed from arena to arena and must destroy all the hordes there.The game has just 6 levels. Sensei Cow has indian accent and you are japanese ofc.
But the accents doesn't make it better. Biggest problem: the game is hard to handle even with XBOX Controller. Coins are nearly useless. (100 coins are an extra life but mostly the level just contains less and on the next level you start at 0 again). The whirlwind attack clears mostly everything and with shurikens you can kill the last remaining creatures.
Read More
 
Was this review helpful? Yes No Funny
8 of 8 people (100%) found this review helpful
SpaceCouncil
1,088 products in account
63 reviews
Not Recommended
0.1 hrs on record
Posted: August 25
I play a lot of rather absurd, less than stellar games. This one is by far one of the most egregious.

Let me just list some things strait off.
- Zero camera control
- Most attacks as well as interaction come at the cost of not moving at all. Direction can be added after taking action. What I mean to say is you cannot touch a direction while trying to attack normally
- the voice acting is borderline racist, in fact it probably is
- I'm not sure if its supposed to look like a paper environment like a Paper Mario or Stick it to the Man but the way it fits into everything else it sure seems like its just some garbage sprites they threw in there in an attempt to make it look like bad game. When in affect its what was actually created.

I understand this was probably supposed to be satirical but it even fails at that. It just comes off as a lazy pile of garbage. One I regret having associated with my steam account even though it was purchased in a bundle.
